1.title: Kat Loses Her Rock
1.plot: Corey confronts Kat and decides to quit High Voltage. Craig hires a new tattoo artist at American Electric but she and Amy get off to a bad start. Corey returns and asks Kat for his job back, forcing Kat to choose between friendship and business.

2.title: Kat's New Journey
2.plot: After Corey returns and asks for his job back, Kat is faced with a dilemma of hiring him back in the shop. She must consult her team and decide what's best for them all. Meanwhile, Amy and new tattoo artist Ruthless continue to be at odds.

3.title: The Return of the Rock?
3.plot: Kat's indecision on whether or not she should bring Corey back to High Voltage. Corey is conflicted about his clients that are still in Hollywood and is getting fed up waiting on Kat to give him an answer. Corey starts to seek other options.

4.title: The Rock Rolls
4.plot: After hearing what the crew has to say, Kat decides to bring Corey back, but he may have changed his mind.

5.title: The Truce
5.plot: Kat gets caught in the middle of a prank war when her roommate, Rooftop, starts trouble with her boyfriend, Nikki Sixx. Corey cuts all ties when he crosses enemy lines and decides to join the team at American Electric.

6.title: Strictly Business
6.plot: Kat heads to New York to meet with Sephora about her new perfume line, and then to Harper Collins Publishers, where she has to give her editor some bad news about her second book. Corey reveals the ugly truth in a magazine interview.

7.title: The Black Widow
7.plot: Kat wakes up to find that a spider has bitten her eye, and the possibility of surgery scares her just as much as not being able to tattoo. Corey calms the tension at American Electric when he agrees to tattoo Amy and Paulie.

8.title: Oh Brother
8.plot: Kat convinces Michael to run a marathon, but after he drops out, she finds other ways to spend time with him. American Electric celebrates its 11th anniversary, and Paulie's refusal to participate angers Craig just as much as Amy's surprise guest.

9.title: Rock and Ink
9.plot: Kat auctions off a tattoo for charity, Nikki Sixx interviews Dan on his radio show, and the crew goes to see Dan's band at The House of Blues. Corey walks in to find Aubry getting tattooed, and Amy finds herself between a rock and a hard place.

10.title: The Missing Piece
10.plot: After noticing that her crew is acting strange, Kat starts digging for information only to find that she may have ruined a great surprise. At American Electric, Ruthless realizes that Amy is covering for Paulie and threatens to tell Craig.

11.title: Wet Paint
11.plot: Kat takes a long look at Corey's face on the mural and decides that it's time for a change. After an unexplained absence, Paulie returns to American Electric with a careless attitude and Craig is forced to fire him.

12.title: Kat Minus Sixx
12.plot: While Kat struggles with the decision to go on tour with Nikki and the future of their relationship, she puts Michael and Rooftop in charge of the event space next door. The tension between Amy and Ruthless reaches a boiling point over a tattoo convention

13.title: Kat in Wonderland
13.plot: As final prep is underway for the opening of Kat's gallery, tensions boil over at AE between Amy and Ruthless. Wonderland opens its doors, Kat and her new boyfriend show up to a full press line and a party full of surprises.

14.title: New Beginnings
14.plot: In the last 9 months, Kat has had a successful gallery opening, a whirlwind book tour, survived a devastating house fire and got engaged to her soul mate, Jesse James. The High Voltage crew tries to keep up as Kat starts over.

15.title: Kat's New Roommate
15.plot: While balancing a long distance relationship with her fiancÃ©, Jesse James, Kat decides to design her own wedding dress with help from the designers of her new clothing line. Later, she heads to NYC for a Sephora photo shoot.

16.title: Tats for Japan
16.plot: Kat and the crew decide to throw a benefit for the earthquake victims in Japan, but find out High Voltage may not be so safe when the big one hits. Tensions rise between Rooftop and Arianna, and when Arianna takes Kat's car without permission.

17.title: Addicted
17.plot: Kat uncovers Arianna's dark secret, when it becomes a matter of life and death. Meanwhile, Dan plays a dodgy prank that turns the shop into a warzone - and Rooftop takes a permanent hit.

18.title: Photo Finish
18.plot: Kat Von D's stress levels reach an all-time high as she must complete a photo shoot in time to showcase her new clothing line to prestigious fashion editors. Michael & Rooftop duke it out in a series of agonizing challenges.

19.title: Kat & Jesse in Baja
19.plot: A trip to her birthplace in Mexico could end in wedding bells or hospital bills for Kat, as Jesse tries for first place in the grueling off-road Baja 500 race. Kat gives Arianna the surprise of her life when Arianna successfully hits 100 days sober.

20.title: While Kat's Away
20.plot: Kat decides to make some upgrades to High Voltage and hires a contractor who has his own ideas. While Kat is in Austin with Jesse, chaos ensues in the shop and on the home front.

21.title: Nothing Is Forever, Not Even Tattoos
21.plot: When Kat decides to open an Austin tattoo shop with Jesse, the High Voltage family fears their home of 5 years may be closing its doors for good. Regret is a bitter pill when Kat hears Michael's big confession. Kat faces the toughest decision of her life.

1.title: Welcome Home, Kat
1.plot: Kat Von D is back in her hometown of LA and she's fulfilling her dream of opening her own tattoo shop. She found a hot location and she plans to make it the coolest shop in town. As construction gets underway, Kat looks everywhere for her dream team.

2.title: No Place to Work
2.plot: Kat's nailed down her dream team, but the shop's not ready when Hannah and Kim arrive to work in LA. Hannah's worried Kim might drop out. Fortunately, Corey agrees to let the entire crew work out of his shop until LA Ink opens.

3.title: LA Ink Grand Opening
3.plot: LA INK is open for business and Kat Von D and her crew celebrate with a huge rock n roll bash! It's been a struggle getting her dream shop off the ground but it's done and now the whole city will see if Kat has what it takes to run her own business.

4.title: Boobs Rule
4.plot: While bathing suit shopping with Pixie, Kat learns her recent weight loss has changed more than her waistline. Pixie gives Kat the hard sell on breast implants. But before Kat goes under the knife, she does a test run on the girls at the shop.

5.title: Master Cleanse
5.plot: Kat's overworked and tired, so Kim suggests that they both do a cleanse. Kat raises the stakes by making a bet to see who can last longer.The loser will get tattooed by Steve O.Nashville's Emerson Drive stops by the shop to celebrate their first #1 song.

6.title: Corey's Vasectomy
6.plot: Corey contemplates getting a vasectomy, but it's a tougher decision then he thought it would be. Kat surprises Pixie by getting a portrait tattoo of her to show her how much she loves her. In the shop, Hannah tattoos a fighting fish on Raye.

7.title: Pixie's Surgery
7.plot: Kat and the team learn the true meaning of sisterhood when Pixie falls sick but can't afford the surgery she desperately needs. Corey turns to occult art to find inspiration and tattoos a creepy portrait for his friend.

8.title: Kat's Gnarly Day
8.plot: Kat invites her father to visit the shop and nothing goes down as planned. When she's five hours late to work things get chaotic. Her rock star client Frank Iero of the band My Chemical Romance looks for ways to pass the time.

9.title: Kim Looks for Love
9.plot: Kim's single and ready to mingle. The crew is determined to find her a good man and she finally takes a gamble on love at Drag Queen Bingo.Chris combines his two passions in life in a rockabilly style pin up.

10.title: Kat's in Love
10.plot: Kat's business is booming but her personal life has been suffering as a result. Kat has managed to meet a guy who she vibes with but has some doubts about jumping into a relationship so quickly after her recent divorce.

11.title: Holly's Here
11.plot: Hannah's daughter Holly comes to check out L.A., but Hannah's stuck working at the shop. While she tries to break free, Rita Haney tells Kat the tragic story of the death of her soul mate - Pantera's guitarist Dimebag Darrell.

12.title: Pixie's Got the Blues
12.plot: Pixie is going through relationship issues so the girls rally around her to help her cope. Bonnie pays tribute to her music with a piece from Corey and in the process helps bring a smile to Pixie's face. And Sebastian Bach shows he's still rock-n-roll.

13.title: Big Decisions
13.plot: Hannah goes home to Chicago, maybe for good. Kat takes a break from the shop and leaves Corey in charge.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

16.title: Kat Cleans Up
16.plot: To help Kat tame her wild ways she impulsively moves in with her boyfriend Orbi.Meanwhile, in the shop Hannah tattoos a mermaid for Rebecca to help her confront her horrors of surviving the tsunami that almost took her life.

17.title: New Beginnings
17.plot: The crew looks to make a fresh start. Pixie undergoes laser tattoo removal to make room for a very important tattoo. Kat hires her sister to be her personal assistant and plans a surprise with the help of comedian Tom Green.

18.title: Novelty Girls
18.plot: Kat tattoos a classic portrait of Orbi's father, rock n roll legend, Roy Orbison. Pixie and Kim discover the ups and downs of being single when they try speed dating.

19.title: Skate Ramp
19.plot: Kat builds a full sized skate ramp inside the shop; Hannah is not happy with the contraption being next to her work station. With construction going on at the shop, Corey and Kim work out of Corey's shop.

20.title: Kat's World Record
20.plot: Kat decides she wants to set a world record for doing 400 tattoos within 24 hours, but with less than a week to plan the event she might be attempting the impossible.

21.title: Kat Gets a Scare
21.plot: After some intense pains, Kat consults a doctor and is rushed into surgery. The shop is forced to carry on with a guest artist, the legendary tattooer Bob Tyrrell.

22.title: Corey's Dilemma
22.plot: Corey promises to help Kat with her tattoo and music convention, MusInk, but finds that his family commitments don't leave much time for anything else. Meanwhile, the artists' problems with Pixie heat up.

23.title: The Worst Day Ever
23.plot: After Kim complains to Kat about Pixie's work ethic, Kat confronts Pixie. But she is unable to contain the situation as it spirals out of control in front of the entire shop and customers.

24.title: Life After Pixie
24.plot: Kat, her crew - and Pixie - all try to pick up the pieces after the big blow up the previous week which ended with Pixie quitting her job. Kat hires a new shop manager, while Hannah goes to see Pixie to try to make sense of everything that's happened.

25.title: Orbi's Secret
25.plot: Hannah's brother, Guy Aitchison, rolls into the shop as a guest artist. And Orbi contemplates proposing marriage to Kat, the old-fashioned way: he's asking her dad for permission.

1.title: Help Wanted
1.plot: The shop's growing, and keeping it running smoothly has everyone stressed out. Kat needs more help, but struggles with whether to hire another friend as manager. Rocker Dave Navarro visits Kat for a pinup style portrait memorializing him mom.

2.title: Comic Relief
2.plot: Hannah attempts to transform the crew at the shop into larger than life comic book characters. Naheed has her work cut out for her with the serious business of managing the shop while trying to bond with the crew at the same time.

3.title: CrueFest
3.plot: Kat Von D and her tattoo crew get to rock it out at Motley Crue. Kat gets a surprise visit from her guy, Motley Crue musician Nikki Sixx, who wants a portrait of his friend and fellow band member Mick Mars.

4.title: Cover Girl
4.plot: Kat scores the cover of Latina magazine! She takes the magazine's reporter, along with her brother and sister, to her hometown for a trip down Von D memory lane. Phenomenal booty model, Elke the Stallion, asks Corey for a special set of wings.

5.title: Corey's Fort
5.plot: Corey loves the environment at LA Ink, but his long commute every day is keeping him from his kids. Kat tattoos rapper The Game, who's thinking about quitting music to be a family man. Kat gives Jason a portrait of his baby daughter who recently passed.

6.title: Kat Get's Hypnotized
6.plot: When Kat and her fellow smokers in the shop decide to kick the habit, they seek the help of a hypnotist. Singer Yolanda Perez shares her struggle with being a single mom. Kat brings a photo of Don's wife to life.

7.title: Kim's Big Deal
7.plot: Kim seizes the opportunity of a lifetime when she's approached by a shoe manufacturer to provide artwork for their new line. Corey and Hannah discover the need for speed when they hook up with the nation's top female rally car driver.

8.title: Kat Tales
8.plot: Kat's up against a tight deadline on her latest project-a book about her art-and she's still got some important things to get done. Matt Bradley, of Discovery's "Deadliest Catch," steps off his fishing boat and into the shop.

9.title: Hannah and Corey Jam Session
9.plot: Naheed crosses a line when Kat gives her a heavy metal momma on a black horse with razor teeth on her forearm. Dan, a world-famous architect isn't too sure he wants a tattoo, then isn't certain Hannah's up to doing his very complicated artwork!

10.title: Funny Farm
10.plot: Kat signs up for a big project outside the tattoo shop - redecorating her musician boyfriend Nikki Sixx's recording studio, Funny Farm. Kim gives soap actor Kristoff St. John a philosophical to remind him what makes him strong.

11.title: It's All About the Family
11.plot: Kat tattoos rock legend Lemmy from Motorhead. Hannah spends some quality time with her daughter and tries to sort out the past. When Kat's little brother joins the crew, she plans a killer party to welcome him back to LA.

12.title: 66 Nikkis
12.plot: Nikki Sixx's work with Covenant House inspires Kat to get involved, but she stresses out when planning a benefit goes down to the wire. Olympic soccer star Natasha Kai stops by the shop to show off the gold. Corey dedicates a tattoo to his son.

1.title: Kat's Back
1.plot: Kat returns to her beloved Los Angeles after being away for months on her book tour - the longest she's been away from LA Ink. The shop's more successful than ever - and even busier now that Hannah and Kim are gone.

2.title: Stranger in My Shop
2.plot: The shop is slammed so Kat goes against her policy of only hiring people she knows, bringing in Amy as a possible new tattoo artist. While Aubrey does her best to learn the ropes, Amy tries to prove herself.

3.title: Kat Bares It All
3.plot: Kat bares it all at a New York photo shoot to promote her new cosmetic line rendering her tattoo-less. Kat convinces her good friend, Nikko, to guest spot for a couple days and he wows everyone with a gory portrait.

4.title: Aubrey Tries to Help
4.plot: Aubry's on thin ice with the shop when she tries to win the team over with her crazy antics. She finally crosses the line when she tries to redecorate Kat's station and her future as shop manager is in jeopardy.

5.title: Tick, Tock, Biological Clock
5.plot: Aubry's efforts to fit in have been causing tension in the shop, so Kat calls on everyone to make her feel welcome. In her own attempt to reach out, Kat sets Aubry up on a blind date with a good friend, where Aubry drops the "I want a baby" bomb.

6.title: While Kat's Away, Aubry will Play
6.plot: When Kat finds out she must travel back to New York City to help promote her new fragrance line, she brings in tattoo artist, Dan Smith, to help out in the busy shop. Meanwhile, Aubry's antics wear Adrienne down as the work piles up.

7.title: Feelings Rule
7.plot: Kat begins a second book based on her private tattoo journals--work that triggers deep emotional reactions. Aubry ponders getting a tattoo, Paulie worries about not getting any clients and his feelings hit the boiling point.

8.title: Tramp Stamp of Approval
8.plot: When Kat learns Aubry's getting a tattoo she's concerned that Aubry isn't doing it for the right reasons. Aubry was planning to get a tattoo anyway but she's also hoping that getting one at the shop will have the added bonus of earning her some respect.

9.title: Sobriety & Sisterhood
9.plot: Kat's been clean and sober for two years and the shop wants to mark the occasion with a special surprise. Kat celebrates her own way by tattooing her sister Karoline. In the meantime, Aubry is planning to hit the stage and perform stand up comedy.

10.title: Outside Interests
10.plot: Kat is caught off guard when Dan reminds her that he's taking time off from the shop to record some songs with his band. Meanwhile, Paulie's frustration with not getting any work at High Voltage builds to a head, leading to a heated confrontation.

11.title: Blonde Ambition
11.plot: Kat's moving toward a new positive energy in her life, and she's celebrating by dying her hair blonde and getting a tattoo of one of her musical idols: Johnette Napolitano. Kat's mood quickly changes when Aubry plays hooky leaving LA Ink shorthanded.

12.title: LA Pink
12.plot: Breast Cancer affects everyone in the shop and Kat reveals how one doctor's visit changed her life forever. Meanwhile, Aubry attempts to win over the crew, but Corey is not impressed.

13.title: Final Showdown
13.plot: Pushed to the limit, Corey finally unleashes his pent up anger at Aubry when she does the unthinkable with one of his clients. Now at the breaking point, he questions his role at LA Ink and backs Kat into a corner forcing her to make a critical decision.

14.title: Showdown at the Shop
14.plot: Kat is forced to take sides when a long-simmering feud explodes between Corey and Aubry. Kat's sister Karoline announces a sudden departure leaving Kat short handed at a critical time in the shop.

15.title: Training Day
15.plot: Kat's new shop manager Liz is all business, and while Kat likes her no nonsense approach, she rubs the LA Ink crew the wrong way. Meanwhile, Aubry's friends, former LA Ink employees Paulie and Amy struggle to get her a job at American Electric.

16.title: What's Wrong Kat?
16.plot: Kat has shocking news about her beloved cat Ludwig and is frustrated with shop manager Liz's superior attitude toward shop basics. At rival shop American Electric, Craig challenges Aubry's competence, and welcomes a long overdue visit from his brother.

17.title: Whose Party Is It?
17.plot: Kat tattoo's rap superstar Soulja Boy and when a shop party is planned the gloves come off between shop managers Adrienne and Liz with Kat caught in the middle. Aubry struggles with her decision to remove her LA Ink tattoo.

18.title: Gone Too Far
18.plot: Kat puts an end to the back stabbing between Adrienne and Liz before it gets out of hand. Meanwhile Corey's stress begins to surface in the shop. At American Electric, Craig puts Paulie's color skills to the test and Aubry considers another tattoo.

19.title: Enough Is Enough!
19.plot: Kat lays down the law and stops the escalating battle between Adrienne and Liz for power in the shop. Aubry over steps her bounds with plan for a makeup studio at American Electric.

20.title: Challenge for Kat
20.plot: Kat pushes her art to a new level when she tattoos prosthetic limbs for amputees Rob & Scott and lays down the law with Corey and the team about shop policy. At AE, Paulie's tattoo client invites him to work on a music video with Snoop Dogg.

21.title: Feeling the Heat
21.plot: The entire shop is feeling the pressure from the mounting tension between Kat and Corey. The lack of support at Corey's band performance leaves him wondering who his real friends are. At AE, Paulie infuriates Aubry when his meeting with Corey is revealed.

22.title: Tension Between Friends
22.plot: Tension between Kat and Corey escalates and the shop is on edge. Liz betrays Corey and reveals details about a private conversation. Liz's on the job frustration leads her to seek out former shop manager Aubry where she reveals her true motivations.

23.title: Caught in a Lie
23.plot: Kat puts her photography skills to good use in support of a Battered Woman's benefit. Without Kat's authority Liz gives Corey time off and gets caught in a lie. Aubry quits her job at American Electric to follow her true passions.

24.title: Time Is Up
24.plot: Kat discovers Liz lied and Liz pays the ultimate consequence. Kat is heart broken by Corey's painful decision and their friendship is put to the ultimate test.

-1.title: Legal Vending Machine
-1.plot:

imdb.plot outline: Kat Von D has come home to Los Angeles to fulfill her dream of opening up her own tattoo shop. The news has spread and celebrities, rising starlets, punk rockers, musicians and tattoo collectors alike are lining up for some of Kat's famous black and grey ink. In a city known for its tattoo culture, LA Ink is sure to stand out - drawing clients from all over the world and from all walks of life. But with popularity comes headaches, drama and a lot of hard work. Playing by her own rules, Kat lives a fast-paced, rebel lifestyle. Hers is a life of freedom: she sets her own schedule, picks her clients, sleeps late,and parties all night. For her shop to be a success, Kat will need to learn how to balance her lifestyle and her business while managing a colorful staff of renowned artists. LA Ink will offer a rare glimpse into an LA that is seldom seen, through the eyes of a true insider.
imdb.title: LA Ink
plot: Kat Von D has come home to Los Angeles to fulfill her dream of opening up her own tattoo shop. The news has spread and celebrities, rising starlets, punk rockers, musicians and tattoo collectors alike are lining up for some of Kat's famous black and grey ink. In a city known for its tattoo culture, _LA Ink_ (qv) is sure to stand out - drawing clients from all over the world and from all walks of life. But with popularity comes headaches, drama and a lot of hard work. Playing by her own rules, Kat lives a fast-paced, rebel lifestyle. Hers is a life of freedom: she sets her own schedule, picks her clients, sleeps late,and parties all night. For her shop to be a success, Kat will need to learn how to balance her lifestyle and her business while managing a colorful staff of renowned artists. _LA Ink_ (qv) will offer a rare glimpse into an LA that is seldom seen, through the eyes of a true insider.::Jiilo_Kim
